intro: Amyema lutea, commonly known as the yellow mistflower, is a flowering plant native to parts of Australia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Amyema lutea typically grows in open woodlands and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. Its foliage is narrow and grass-like, with a soft, feathery appearance that adds ornamental value to gardens.
